p: The entire sample of 2113 people was used for the general contextual analysis. Missing-ness was present in all outcome measures and ranged from 0.05% (for P. falciparum) to 11.1% (for M. tuberculosis). Missing-ness was related to an absence of a particular sample type (blood or faeces), typically due to inadequate volumes collected or because of participant unwillingness to provide it.
